verses.verse: And it came to pass in the <S%H2320>month<s%> <S%H5212>Nisan<s%>, in the <S%H6242>twentieth<s%> <S%H8141>year<s%> of <S%H783>Artaxerxes<s%> the <S%H4428>king<s%>, when <S%H3196>wine<s%> was <S%H6440>before<s%> <S%H5375>him<s%>, that I took up the <S%H3196>wine<s%>, and <S%H5414>gave<s%> it unto the <S%H4428>king<s%>. Now I had not been beforetime <S%H7451>sad<s%> in his <S%H6440>presence<s%>.

And the <S%H4428>king<s%> <S%H559>said<s%> unto <S%H6440>me<s%>, Why is thy countenance <S%H7451>sad<s%>, seeing thou art not <S%H2470>sick<s%>? this is nothing else but <S%H7455>sorrow<s%> of <S%H3820>heart<s%>. Then I was <S%H3966>very<s%> <S%H7235>sore<s%> <S%H3372>afraid<s%>.

And I <S%H559>said<s%> unto the <S%H4428>king<s%>, Let the <S%H4428>king<s%> <S%H2421>live<s%> for <S%H5769>ever<s%>: why should not my <S%H6440>countenance<s%> be <S%H3415>sad<s%>, when the <S%H5892>city<s%>, the <S%H1004>place<s%> of my <S%H1>fathers<s%>' <S%H6913>sepulchres<s%>, lieth <S%H2720>waste<s%>, and the <S%H8179>gates<s%> thereof are <S%H398>consumed<s%> with <S%H784>fire<s%>?
Then the <S%H4428>king<s%> <S%H559>said<s%> unto <S%H1245>me<s%>, For what dost thou make request? So I <S%H6419>prayed<s%> to the <S%H430>God<s%> of <S%H8064>heaven<s%>.

And I <S%H559>said<s%> unto the <S%H4428>king<s%>, If it <S%H2895>please<s%> the <S%H4428>king<s%>, and if thy <S%H5650>servant<s%> have found <S%H3190>favor<s%> in thy <S%H6440>sight<s%>, that thou wouldest <S%H7971>send<s%> me unto <S%H3063>Judah<s%>, unto the <S%H5892>city<s%> of my <S%H1>fathers<s%>' <S%H6913>sepulchres<s%>, that I may build <S%H1129>it<s%>.

And the <S%H4428>king<s%> <S%H559>said<s%> unto <S%H7694>me<s%> (the queen also <S%H3427>sitting<s%> by <S%H681>him<s%>,) For how long shall thy <S%H4109>journey<s%> <S%H7725>be<s%>? and when wilt thou return? So it <S%H3190>pleased<s%> the <S%H4428>king<s%> to <S%H7971>send<s%> <S%H5414>me<s%>; and I set him a <S%H2165>time<s%>.

Moreover I <S%H559>said<s%> unto the <S%H4428>king<s%>, If it <S%H2895>please<s%> the <S%H4428>king<s%>, let <S%H107>letters<s%> be <S%H5414>given<s%> me to the <S%H6346>governors<s%> <S%H5676>beyond<s%> the <S%H5104>River<s%>, that they may let me pass <S%H5674>through<s%> till I <S%H935>come<s%> unto <S%H3063>Judah<s%>;

and a <S%H107>letter<s%> unto <S%H623>Asaph<s%> the <S%H8104>keeper<s%> of the <S%H4428>king<s%>'s <S%H6508>forest<s%>, that he may <S%H5414>give<s%> me <S%H6086>timber<s%> to make <S%H7136>beams<s%> for the <S%H8179>gates<s%> of the <S%H1002>castle<s%> which appertaineth to the <S%H1004>house<s%>, and for the <S%H2346>wall<s%> of the <S%H5892>city<s%>, and for the <S%H1004>house<s%> that I shall enter <S%H935>into<s%>. And the <S%H4428>king<s%> <S%H5414>granted<s%> <S%H2896>me<s%>, according to the good <S%H3027>hand<s%> of my God upon <S%H430>me<s%>.

Then I <S%H935>came<s%> to the <S%H6346>governors<s%> <S%H5676>beyond<s%> the <S%H5104>River<s%>, and <S%H5414>gave<s%> them the <S%H4428>king<s%>'s <S%H107>letters<s%>. Now the <S%H4428>king<s%> had <S%H7971>sent<s%> with me <S%H8269>captains<s%> of the <S%H2428>army<s%> and <S%H6571>horsemen<s%>.

And when <S%H5571>Sanballat<s%> the <S%H2772>Horonite<s%>, and <S%H2900>Tobiah<s%> the <S%H5650>servant<s%>, the <S%H5984>Ammonite<s%>, <S%H8085>heard<s%> of <S%H3415>it<s%>, it grieved them <S%H7451>exceedingly<s%>, for that there was <S%H935>come<s%> a <S%H120>man<s%> to <S%H1245>seek<s%> the <S%H2896>welfare<s%> of the <S%H1121>children<s%> of <S%H3478>Israel<s%>.
So I <S%H935>came<s%> to <S%H3389>Jerusalem<s%>, and was there <S%H7969>three<s%> <S%H3117>days<s%>.

And I <S%H6965>arose<s%> in the <S%H3915>night<s%>, I and <S%H4592>some<s%> <S%H4592>few<s%> <S%H582>men<s%> with <S%H5046>me<s%>; neither told I any <S%H120>man<s%> what my <S%H430>God<s%> <S%H5414>put<s%> into my <S%H3820>heart<s%> to <S%H6213>do<s%> for <S%H3389>Jerusalem<s%>; neither was there any <S%H929>beast<s%> with <S%H929>me<s%>, save the beast that I rode <S%H7392>upon<s%>.

And I went <S%H3318>out<s%> by <S%H3915>night<s%> by the <S%H1516>valley<s%> <S%H8179>gate<s%>, even <S%H6440>toward<s%> the <S%H8577>jackal<s%>'s <S%H5869>well<s%>, and to the <S%H830>dung<s%> <S%H8179>gate<s%>, and <S%H7663>viewed<s%> the <S%H2346>walls<s%> of <S%H3389>Jerusalem<s%>, which were broken <S%H6555>down<s%>, and the <S%H8179>gates<s%> thereof were <S%H398>consumed<s%> with <S%H784>fire<s%>.

Then I went <S%H5674>on<s%> to the <S%H5869>fountain<s%> <S%H8179>gate<s%> and to the <S%H4428>king<s%>'s <S%H1295>pool<s%>: but there was no <S%H4725>place<s%> for the <S%H929>beast<s%> that was under me to <S%H5674>pass<s%>.

Then went I <S%H5927>up<s%> in the <S%H3915>night<s%> by the <S%H5158>brook<s%>, and <S%H7663>viewed<s%> the <S%H2346>wall<s%>; and I turned <S%H7725>back<s%>, and <S%H935>entered<s%> by the <S%H1516>valley<s%> <S%H8179>gate<s%>, and so <S%H7725>returned<s%>.

And the <S%H5461>rulers<s%> <S%H3045>knew<s%> not whither I <S%H1980>went<s%>, or what I <S%H6213>did<s%>; neither had I as <S%H3651>yet<s%> <S%H5046>told<s%> it to the <S%H3064>Jews<s%>, nor to the <S%H3548>priests<s%>, nor to the <S%H2715>nobles<s%>, nor to the <S%H5461>rulers<s%>, nor to the <S%H3499>rest<s%> that <S%H6213>did<s%> the <S%H4399>work<s%>.

Then <S%H559>said<s%> I unto <S%H7200>them<s%>, Ye see the <S%H7451>evil<s%> case that we are <S%H3389>in<s%>, how Jerusalem lieth <S%H2720>waste<s%>, and the <S%H8179>gates<s%> thereof are <S%H3341>burned<s%> with <S%H784>fire<s%>: <S%H3212>come<s%>, and let us build <S%H1129>up<s%> the <S%H2346>wall<s%> of <S%H3389>Jerusalem<s%>, that we be no more a <S%H2781>reproach<s%>.

And I <S%H5046>told<s%> them of the <S%H3027>hand<s%> of my <S%H430>God<s%> which was <S%H2896>good<s%> upon <S%H4428>me<s%>, as also of the king's <S%H1697>words<s%> that he had <S%H559>spoken<s%> unto <S%H559>me<s%>. And they said, Let us rise <S%H6965>up<s%> and <S%H1129>build<s%>. So they <S%H2388>strengthened<s%> their <S%H3027>hands<s%> for the good <S%H2896>work<s%>.

But when <S%H5571>Sanballat<s%> the <S%H2772>Horonite<s%>, and <S%H2900>Tobiah<s%> the <S%H5650>servant<s%>, the <S%H5984>Ammonite<s%>, and <S%H1654>Geshem<s%> the <S%H6163>Arabian<s%>, <S%H8085>heard<s%> <S%H3932>it<s%>, they laughed us to scorn, and <S%H959>despised<s%> <S%H559>us<s%>, and said, What is this <S%H1697>thing<s%> that ye <S%H6213>do<s%>? will ye <S%H4775>rebel<s%> against the <S%H4428>king<s%>?

Then <S%H7725>answered<s%> I <S%H559>them<s%>, and said unto <S%H430>them<s%>, The God of <S%H8064>heaven<s%>, he will <S%H6743>prosper<s%> <S%H5650>us<s%>; therefore we his servants will <S%H6965>arise<s%> and <S%H1129>build<s%>: but ye have no <S%H2506>portion<s%>, nor <S%H6666>right<s%>, nor <S%H2146>memorial<s%>, in <S%H3389>Jerusalem<s%>.
